definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: The active area on the right churns with magnetic loops.
sentences.chinese: 右侧活动区域被磁环搅乱。

sentences.english: They shuffled the pieces on the floor and then dropped them into the shoe.
sentences.chinese: 大家把纸条放在地下搅乱，然后装进了鞋子里。

sentences.english: So I and my husband has been totally disrupted .
sentences.chinese: 所以我和老公的新完全被搅乱了。

sentences.english: The bad news disrupted our conference.
sentences.chinese: 这则坏消息搅乱了我们的会议。

sentences.english: Your foolishness is playing ducks and drakes with our plans.
sentences.chinese: 你的愚蠢行为把我们的计划全搅乱了。

sentences.english: Her face haunts my dreams like the rain at night.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸，如夜雨似的，搅乱我的梦魂。

sentences.english: That is, it jumbles up it's program code to make it difficult to detect.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着它把搅乱它程序代码，从而使它难以被发现。

sentences.english: Hatred confuses life; love harmonizes it. Hatred darkens life;
sentences.chinese: 仇恨把生活搅乱，爱将其协调。

sentences.english: What puts a spanner into this adjustment mechanism is the rise in global inflation.
sentences.chinese: 进一步搅乱这种调整机制的是全球通胀率的上升。

sentences.english: Don't try to becloud the basic issues.
sentences.chinese: 别企图把基本问题搅乱了。

sentences.english: The endangered ranger's estrangement deranged my long-range plan.
sentences.chinese: 遭受危险的看林人的离间搅乱了我的长期计划。

sentences.english: He'll smooth or mess up his hair.
sentences.chinese: 他或许会将头发梳齐，也可能将其搅乱。

sentences.english: The sudden children suddenly disturbed Song Di of quiet life.
sentences.chinese: 这突如其来的孩子一下子就搅乱了宋迪之平静的生活。

sentences.english: There won't be any Arizona Cardinal-type run to ruin Stern's party.
sentences.chinese: 斯特恩不允许再有红衣主教那样的人搅乱他的派对。

definition: to mess up/to mismanage/to bungle/to confuse/to muddle
to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
to upset the apple cart/to disrupt things
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain/also written 渾水摸魚|浑水摸鱼
